senses.de: An agreement or plan you make for something
senses.ex: We have an arrangement to meet at the park at 2 pm.

Tips.title: Conditional Plan
Tips.description: An 'arrangement' often implies a flexible plan that might change based on conditions.
Tips.example: Our arrangement to see the movie depends on the weather.

Tips.title: Mutual Understanding
Tips.description: 'Arrangement' suggests a mutual understanding or expectation between parties.
Tips.example: We have an arrangement not to bring up politics at dinner.

Tips.title: Often Informal
Tips.description: This type of 'arrangement' is less formal than a contract and often made verbally.
Tips.example: Let's make an arrangement to split the project work.

senses.de: The way things are organized or set up
senses.ex: The arrangement of the tables allows for a clear view of the stage.

Tips.title: Physical Layout
Tips.description: 'Arrangement' in this sense refers to the physical placement of items or people.
Tips.example: Consider the arrangement of chairs when planning the party.

Tips.title: Visual Impact
Tips.description: The visual impact or practical function is often a key aspect in this context.
Tips.example: The arrangement of lights made the room look larger.

Tips.title: Ease of Access
Tips.description: Consider how the 'arrangement' affects movement and accessibility.
Tips.example: The office arrangement should allow easy access to the printer.

senses.de: A piece of music that has been adapted for performance by a particular set of voices or instruments
senses.ex: The conductor created a new arrangement of the classic song for the choir.

Tips.title: Musical Adaptation
Tips.description: Refers to adapting a piece for performance, sometimes changing the style or mood.
Tips.example: The jazz arrangement of the classical piece was impressive.

Tips.title: Performer's Edition
Tips.description: May highlight an instrument or voice part not featured in the original composition.
Tips.example: The new arrangement puts the violins in the spotlight.

Tips.title: Creative License
Tips.description: Arrangers often use creative license to add personal touches to the music.
Tips.example: Her arrangement included a unique guitar solo.

senses.de: A thing that has been arranged in a neat or attractive way
senses.ex: She admired the beautiful arrangement of flowers on the table.

Tips.title: Artistic Display
Tips.description: The focus is on creating a visually attractive display, like with flowers or objects.
Tips.example: The centerpiece was an intricate arrangement of autumn leaves and candles.

Tips.title: Not Just Random
Tips.description: 'Arrangement' suggests careful selection and placement, not haphazard.
Tips.example: Each item's placement in the arrangement had a specific purpose.

Tips.title: Conveys Emotion
Tips.description: An arrangement can be designed to evoke a particular feeling or theme.
Tips.example: The somber arrangement of photos at the memorial was moving.

Composition.wordDefinition:
Composition refers to the creation of something new from scratch.

Arrangement pertains to the modification of something that already exists whereas composition pertains to inventing something new.

Configuration.wordDefinition:
Arrangement and configuration are similar words that describe the way things or objects are put together or organized.

Configuration is a bit more specific, and usually refers to the shape, design or layout of something. It often implies that the arrangement of parts is vital to the functioning of the whole.

For example, the configuration of a computer network is the way the computers, wires, and other equipment are set up and connected together in order to make the network function effectively.

To summarize, arrangement is a more general term for how things are positioned or organized, while configuration refers to a specific arrangement of parts or components that makes something work the way it should.

Design.wordDefinition:
Design refers to the process of planning and creating something from scratch. This could be a graphic design, a fashion design, or even the design of a building.

Arrangement is about organizing existing things, while design is about creating something new. Arrangement is applicable in situations where you are working with pre-existing elements, such as arranging furniture in a room or organizing a group of people.

Design is applicable when you are starting from scratch and creating something new, such as designing a logo or building a new website.

Layout.wordDefinition:
Layout refers to the way that elements are arranged in a printed or digital document, website, or similar item. It usually refers to the visual design of something.

For example, the layout of a magazine page, website or an office.

Arrangement is used for physical things while layout is for design or digital things.

Order.wordDefinition:
An arrangement is how things are organized or placed in a particular order to achieve a specific goal or create a certain effect.

Order refers to a systematic or logical arrangement of things, such as in a sequence, in a hierarchy, or in a specific pattern.

It often involves following a set of rules, procedures, or principles, and is often used in scientific, numerical, or procedural contexts, such as in alphabetical order, chronological order, or numerical order.

Arrangement is more subjective and artistic, while order is more objective and logical. Both terms are useful depending on the context and purpose of the situation.

Organization.wordDefinition:
Organization refers to the overall structure or system that governs how things work together. It involves planning and coordinating people, resources, or tasks to achieve a specific goal.

For example, a company has an organizational structure that determines the roles and responsibilities of its employees, while a project requires good organization to allocate resources, manage time and budget, and track progress.

Arrangement is about how things are physically placed, while organization is about how things are managed and structured to achieve a goal.

Plan.wordDefinition:
An arrangement is a specific way things are organized or arranged, while a plan is a detailed proposal for achieving a particular goal.

A plan is applicable when it refers to the strategy or method by which a specific objective or outcome is achieved, for example, a business plan, a study plan, or a vacation plan.

An arrangement is about how things are organized or laid out, while a plan is about how to achieve a specific goal.

Scheme.wordDefinition:
A scheme refers to a plan or a project that can be devised for a particular purpose or to achieve a particular goal.

A scheme is applicable in situations where a plan is needed to achieve a specific outcome, such as a business scheme to improve profits or a government scheme to provide free healthcare to citizens.

In other words, an arrangement is about how things are organized or set up, while a scheme is about a plan or strategy to achieve a desired goal.

System.wordDefinition:
System refers to a set of things or ideas that work together in a structured way to produce a particular result.

For example, the respiratory system in your body includes your lungs, nose, and throat, which all work together to help you breathe.

You would use the word arrangement when you're talking about how things are organized or put together in a specific order, and you would use the word system when you're talking about a structured set of things that work together to produce a particular result.

quotes.Text: I started trying to do my own music at home, and I was like, 'You know what, I can play the guitar, sort of. And I can do these things, sort of. And I can make these crazy noises on my computer, sort of. But I need a ridiculously good drummer. I need someone to help me with string arrangements.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Steve Burns

quotes.Text: My music is mostly for the music. And it gives the liberty to do anything which I want. And nobody limits me to one genre of music. But I learn from life and I try to give back to life, in a way, whether it's the thought of the song or whether it's the approach to the arrangement or anything.
quotes.Title: Indian Musician
quotes.Name: A. R. Rahman

quotes.Text: When I sing a tune, the lyrics are important to me. Most of the standard lyrics I know well. And as soon as I hear an arrangement, I get ideas, kind of like blowing a horn. I guess I never sing a tune the same way twice.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Sarah Vaughan

quotes.Text: I can make a record with six-part string arrangements and the best musicians in the world and have it be not genuine. I'd rather make a genuine record that I truly stand behind and have it fall where it may.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Julien Baker

quotes.Text: I'm in the process of working out an arrangement to make some very, very, very small films in the midst of all these films and maybe that will help. But you get tired of talking. You just want to do it.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Steven Soderbergh

quotes.Text: I learned a lot from that first record and I learned a lot from my experiences touring, but really the biggest education I got over the past two years was learning the importance of arrangements.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Vanessa Carlton

quotes.Text: The thing to remember when you're re-recording pieces from the past is that you have to have respect for the original performances, recordings, and arrangements.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Ian Gillan

quotes.Text: If the individual is to be happy in the contemporary order, he must be open-minded with respect to new values and new arrangements.
quotes.Title: English Politician
quotes.Name: Thomas Cochrane

quotes.Text: We really like having songs where we think the arrangement is just as important as the melodies, even though they're typically not.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: M. Shadows

quotes.Text: One sure way to lose another woman's friendship is to try to improve her flower arrangements.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Marcelene Cox
